lines.text:
[the two women watch as Jack climbs the beanstalk, then the villager turns to the tearful mother]
"Don't worry, Mrs Strong. He won't be back."
[first lines]
Come in. Oh it's you. I'm sorry Arthur, I thought it was the babysitter.
Just what do you have against babysitters?
Mother, look, the beanstalk!

[singing]
I fear nothing when I am in the right / Whoever pushes me around will find me full of fight.

[about the Princess]
We gotta save her.
You're right.
There's the castle. Let's go.
Come on. What am I doing? Go ahead.

[singing]
Darlene a song for darling, Darlene.
[repeated line]
Fee-Fi-Fo-Fum I smell the blood of an Englishman. Be he alive or be he dead, I'll grind his bones to make my bread.
You numbskull! I can't eat, you ruined my appetite.
Oh Mr Giant, you should eat something.
Yeah, yeah, yeah, yeah.
No, no,
Oh yeah.
Oh no, no. Mr. Dinkelpuss! Mr. Dinkelpuss!

[to Receptionist]
I like girls like you, eyes of blue and five feet two.
[repeated line]
Mr. Dinkelpuss!

[singing]
Jack and the beanstalk we'll always remember when / He chased up the stalk and killed a giant in his den.
I managed this boy.
[last lines]

[singing]
I fear nothing when I do nothing wrong / And so I toddle on my way and sing a merry song.
I've been a baby all my life.
Are you as pretty as your name? My guess is yes!
